title: A2329R - Research Methodologist
text:
Job Ref: 82695 
Applications are invited for an enthusiastic and highly motivated Research Methodologist to work with the NIHR Research Design Service North East (NIHR RDS NE). You will also be expected to maintain your status as an active researcher, playing a leading role in your team and developing a growing reputation within your research field. You will support the activities of NIHR RDS NE by being the first point of contact for investigators from the NHS and Higher Education Institutions who are preparing applications for national peer-reviewed funding for health and social care research. 
You will have a PhD in social care research, health research or a related discipline, significant knowledge and experience in your area of research expertise, and training and experience in quantitative and/or qualitative research methods. 
You will have strong interpersonal, communication, negotiation and problem-solving skills and the ability to understand and interpret complex ideas and communicate these simply to broad audiences. 
This post is available immediately until 30th September 2018 for 24 hours per week (0.6fte). 
Further information can be obtained by contacting Professor Luke Vale (via Pauline.winship@ncl.ac.uk ) 
The Institute of Health & Society is committed to supporting equality and diversity for all staff and students. Applications for part time/flexible working will be considered; please state your desired working arrangements in your application.
